summary: Thai Airways, the state-conquoted airline and the fifth largest carrier in Asia, has reported a decrease in Intl Tourist Arrivals, with a 2 to 3% increase from the previous year. The CEO explains that the only market slowing is the China market, but other Asian regions are still growing. He also notes that Thai Airways is becoming a network ally with other countries and plans to expand its reach to Europe. The airline is also planning to fly to 17 different destinations next year, including 11 major European airports. The company also plans to increase its presence in Europe by increasing its capacity to fly up to six hours daily.
shortSummary: Thai Airways reports increasing international tourism arrivals, driven by China, India, and Australia, despite political tensions in THAILAND.
argos_summary: Thai Airways CEO Chai Eamsiri reports that international tourist arrivals are growing across Europe, India, Australia, and North Asia, with China remaining the only lagging market. The airline plans to expand capacity to Europe and strengthen its intercontinental hub in Bangkok, adding 32 new aircraft by 2028 amid a global aircraft shortage. Thai Airways is also exploring second‑hand aircraft and negotiating tariff reductions with the U.S. to support its growth strategy.
